docs.title: Setup Directory Structure
docs.text:
First you need to setup the directory structure for running the examples

  1. Create a BASE folder.

    mkdir lora3a-projects
cd lora3a-projects

  2. Download the RIOT-OS Repository.

    ghgit clone 
    gh repo clone RIOT-OS/RIOT

    git clone https://github.com/RIOT-OS/RIOT.git

    You need to install git if not present on your system.

  3. Download the lora3a-boards repository.

    ghgit clone 
    gh repo clone lora3a/lora3a-boards

    git clone https://github.com/lora3a/lora3a-boards.git

    You need to install git if not present on your system.

Note

This should be the directory structure so far.

lora3a-projects/
├── RIOT/
└── lora3a-boards/

docs.title: Visualizer H10-Fox-Docker
docs.text:
The Visualizer example is a complete app for visualizing the H10 sensor nodes.

This is an overview of the entire app.

graph LR

    SNIFFER("H10 sniffer-raw")
    GATEWAY("Fox Gateway")

    subgraph SENSORS [Sensors]
        direction TB

        SENSOR1("H10 sensor-node 1")
        SENSOR2("H10 sensor-node 2")
        SENSOR3("...")

    end
        SENSOR1 --> SNIFFER
        SENSOR2 --> SNIFFER
        SENSOR3 --> SNIFFER

    SNIFFER --> GATEWAY
    GATEWAY --> DOCKER

    subgraph DOCKER [Docker]
        POSTGRES("Postgres")
        GRAFANA("Grafana")

        POSTGRES --> GRAFANA
    end

    click SENSOR1 "https://github.com/lora3a/lora3a-boards"
    click SENSOR2 "https://github.com/lora3a/lora3a-boards"
    click SENSOR3 "https://github.com/lora3a/lora3a-boards"

    click SNIFFER "https://github.com/lora3a/lora3a-boards"
    click GATEWAY "https://github.com/lora3a/fox_gateway"

    click POSTGRES "https://github.com/lora3a/h10_visualizer"
    click GRAFANA "https://github.com/lora3a/h10_visualizer"

In order to visualize through Grafana the sensors' you will need:

  • Sensors: 1 or more Berta H10
  • Sniffer: 1 Berta H10
  • Gateway: 1 Fox D27 RoadRunner
  • Visualizer: a PC that supports Docker

This will be the Final Directory of our Project

lora3a-boards/
├── fox_gateway/
├── h10_visualizer/
├── lora3a-boards/
└── RIOT/

First follow the Getting Started guide.

docs.title: Setup Sensor Nodes
docs.text: You will Need 1 or more Berta H10.

docs.title: Build and Flash sensor-node example.
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the sensor-node in the examples folder.

    Folder Structure 
    lora3a-projects/
├── fox_gateway/
├── h10_visualizer/
├── lora3a-boards/
│   ├── boards/
│   ├── documentation/
│   ├── examples/
│   │   ├── h10-shell/
│   │   ├── sensor-node/
│   │   ├── sniffer/
│   │   └── sniffer-raw/
│   ├── modules/
│   ├── LICENCE.txt
│   ├── Makefile.include
│   └── README.md
└── RIOT/
    user@machine:~/lora3a-projects$
    cd lora3a-boards/examples/sensor-node/

  2. Connect the Berta H10 to the Atmel-Ice-Basic

  3. Build and Flash the application.

    make build flash
    If you want to see the message being sent

    Connect the Berta H10 with the debugger to the PC

    make PORT=/dev/ttyUSB0 term
